user_request: Show the shopping cart on amazon. Add "macbook air" to the cart on amazon
screen_desc: The screenshot shows a browser interface displaying Amazon's homepage. A menu with several options appears for a link, including "Open in new tab," "Open in incognito tab," "Copy link address," "Copy link text," "Download link," and "Share link." The menu is accessed by selecting the link at the top, and the screen also displays various product categories and promotions at the bottom.
history_actions: click on the "Chrome" browser app icon located at the lower right part of the screen.
click on the browser's address/URL bar located at the middle and top part of the screen.
click on the second search suggestion located at middle and upper part of the screen.
click on the shopping cart icon located at the top right.

think_action.Thought: The user is trying to view the shopping cart on Amazon and add a 'MacBook Air' to it. The shopping cart is visible, and the user has already clicked on the shopping cart icon. I should now focus on adding the desired item ('MacBook Air') to the cart. To do so, I need to search for the 'MacBook Air' on Amazon and select it from the search results.
Future Action Plan: Search for 'MacBook Air' in the search bar on Amazon.
Select the correct 'MacBook Air' from the search results.
Click the 'Add to Cart' button for the selected 'MacBook Air'.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Click on the search bar and type 'MacBook Air'.
